elements.name: clickTo109
elements.html:
{workshopCourse} Summer workshop Post-Survey

Congratulations! You've completed the Code.org {workshopCourse} Summer workshop!

This survey asks questions about your experience today and the week as a whole. 

Privacy and Confidentiality

  • Your individual responses here are completely confidential.
  • Your identity will never be revealed publicly or used to tie any responses back to you personally.
  • We may share de-identified,aggregate data (representing all responses) publicly.
  • Your de-identified responses will be used by Code.org, our Regional Partners, and our facilitators for program improvement.

This survey should take about 10 minutes to complete.  Your complete honesty and candor are appreciated.

elements.name: overall_success
elements.title: How much do you agree or disagree with the following statements about the workshop overall?

rows.value: I feel more prepared to t
rows.text: I feel more prepared to teach the material covered in this workshop than before I came.

rows.value: I know where to go if I n
rows.text: I know where to go if I need help preparing to teach this material.
This professional development was suitable for my level of experience with teaching CS.

rows.value: I feel connected to a com
rows.text: I feel connected to a community of computer science teachers.
I would recommend this professional development to others.
This was the absolute best professional development I have ever participated in.

elements.name: teacher_engagement
elements.title: How much do you agree or disagree with the following statements about your level of engagement in the workshop?

rows.text: I found the activities we did in this workshop interesting and engaging.

rows.value: I was highly active and p
rows.text: I was highly active and participated a lot in the workshop activities.
When I'm not in Code.org workshops, I frequently talk about ideas or content from the workshop with others.
I am definitely planning to make use of ideas and content covered in this workshop in my classroom.

elements.name: curriculum_impressions
elements.title: Having been through this workshop, what are your overall impressions of the {workshopCourse} curriculum?

rows.value: I am going to love teachi
rows.text: I am going to love teaching with this curriculum.
I understand the objectives of and the intention behind the curriculum.
I understand the teaching strategies I am supposed to use in the curriculum.

rows.value: I understand all of the t
rows.text: I understand all of the tools and technologies I am supposed to use in the curriculum.

elements.name: cs_community
elements.title: How much do you agree or disagree with the following statements about your computer science teaching community?

rows.text: When I need help teaching computer science, I have someone to turn to.
I know computer science teacher-leaders and role models in my community.

rows.value: I feel like I'm part of a
rows.text: I feel like I'm part of a broad computer science education movement.
I see my Regional Partner as a hub of resources and support for computer science education in my community.

elements.name: clickTo41
elements.html:
Teaching Philosophy

Below are pairs of statements from computer science teachers describing various teaching philosophies, presented as Statement A and Statement B like so:  

Statement A        Statement B
...   ...

 

  1 2 3 4 5  
Strongly aligned with A  ◉ ◉ ◉ ◉ ◉ Strongly aligned with B
     Leaning towards A   Neutral / Can't Decide   Leaning towards B    

Please read each statement carefully and select the value 1-5 that best shows how closely your own beliefs are to one of the statements in a given pair. Please respond freely based on your personal beliefs and philosophy - there is no wrong way to respond.

elements.name: clickTo85
elements.html:
Statement A        Statement B
"As the teacher, I need to have deep content expertise so that I can properly answer students’ questions and guide instruction appropriately."   "I do not need to have deep expertise in computer science in order to successfully teach it. I have expertise in how to learn, and I can model that for my students as we learn the content together."

elements.name: leadLearner
elements.title: Lead Learner. 1. need deep content expertise ---5. model expertise in how to learn

elements.name: Statement
elements.html:
Statement A        Statement B
"The teacher should ensure that their time and students’ access to resources are distributed equally for all."   "It’s important that the teacher prioritize their time and resources for students who have the most need."

elements.name: prioritizeTime
elements.title: Prioritize Time. 1. distribute equally --- 5. prioritize most need

elements.name: Statement87
elements.html:
Statement A        Statement B
"Instruction and class activities should focus on maintaining high standards and rigor so that students reach the highest level of achievement, even if some students struggle with the material."   "Instruction and class activities should focus on ensuring that students with the least prior knowledge and preparation are not left behind, even if that means that less material can be covered."

elements.name: instructionalFocus
elements.title: Instructional focus. 1. more material,some students struggle --- 5. less material, leave fewer behind

elements.name: Statement101
elements.html:
Statement A        Statement B
"For computer science instruction, I think it’s important to present students with appropriate terms and vocabulary before they explore a concept or problem in more depth."   "I like to present students with a computer science problem, or with tools that let them explore a concept before teaching the terms and vocabulary."

elements.name: abccbv
elements.title: Presentation of vocab.  1. Vocabulary before activity  --- 5. vocabulary after activity

elements.name: Statement96
elements.html:
Statement A        Statement B
"Computer science teachers have a responsibility to recruit a set of students into their classrooms that are representative of the school’s population in terms of diversity (gender, racial, socio-economic, etc.)"   "Computer science teachers’ responsibility is to promote their computer science classes broadly, to all students. The diversity of the class will reflect those most interested in taking a computer science class."

elements.name: recruitResponsibility
elements.title: Recruit Responsibility. 1. recruit representative population    --- 5. recruit students interested in CS

elements.name: clickTo119
elements.html:
Overall Workshop Feedback

We’d like to hear your feedback about your experience this week overall, especially how this professional development could better fit your learning needs, or how it could be improved.

elements.name: activities_you_liked
elements.title: What were the one or two things you liked most about the activities you did in this workshop and why?

elements.name: activities_youd_change
elements.title: What are the one or two things you would change about the activities you did in this workshop?

elements.name: facilitator_feedback_panel
elements.title: Facilitator Feedback
elements.description: Please leave feedback about your facilitator(s).

templateElements.name: facilitator_effectiveness
templateElements.title: During my workshop, {panel.facilitatorName} did the following:

rows.text: Demonstrated knowledge of the curriculum.
Built and sustained an equitable learning environment in our workshop.
Kept the workshop and participants on track.
Supported productive workshop discussions.
Helped me see ways to create and support an equitable learning environment for my students.
Demonstrated a healthy working relationship with their co-facilitator (if applicable).

templateElements.name: facilitator_did_well
templateElements.title: What were two things {panel.facilitatorName} did well?

templateElements.name: facilitator_could_improve
templateElements.title: What were two things {panel.facilitatorName} could do better?

elements.name: iGive
elements.title: I give the workshop organizer permission to quote my written feedback from today for use on social media, promotional materials, and other communications.
choices: Yes, I give the workshop organizer permission to quote me and use my name.
Yes, I give the workshop organizer permission to quote me, but I want to be anonymous.
No, I do not give the workshop organizer my permission.
